docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: As an obstetric anesthesiologist, I was disturbed by the view that women who do not have a ''natural'' birth miss out on ''one of life's great transforming experiences'' (front page, Oct. 13). Is childbirth ''natural'' if it occurs in a heated or cooled building that has electricity and running water? Is it ''natural'' to fight infections with antibiotics or to take out a ruptured appendix?

headline.main: Should Pain Be Part of Childbirth?

docs.abstract: Letter from Kathryn Rosenblum Moxhay says birth pain is a pain with a purpose, and compares it to pain athlete feels during tremendously strenuous activity (S)
docs.snippet: To the Editor:    As an obstetric anesthesiologist, I was disturbed by the view that women who do not have a ''natural'' birth miss out on ''one of life's great transforming experiences'' (front page, Oct. 13). Is childbirth ''natural'' if it occurs...

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Some midwives think that natural childbirth is empowering (front page, Oct. 13). But at some point during my 17-hour, drug-free labor, I began looking forward to my son's birth as the time when my torturous pain would end, rather than as the time when my baby would enter the world. I remember that at the moment of delivery, my eyes were squeezed shut in agony.

headline.main: Should Pain Be Part of Childbirth?

docs.abstract: Letter from Dr Robert F LaPorta, obstetric anesthesiologist, disputes those who say, in Oct 13 article, that pain of childbirth is a transforming experience (S)
docs.snippet: To the Editor:    Some midwives think that natural childbirth is empowering (front page, Oct. 13). But at some point during my 17-hour, drug-free labor, I began looking forward to my son's birth as the time when my torturous pain would end, rather...

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Yes, childbirth is painful (front page, Oct. 13), but it is pain with a purpose for a brief moment in a woman's lifetime. It is not a sickness to be cured.

headline.main: Should Pain Be Part of Childbirth?

docs.abstract: Letter from Nancy Intrator recalls her 17-hour, drug-free labor, and disagrees with those who say natural childbirth is empowering (S)
docs.snippet: To the Editor:    Yes, childbirth is painful (front page, Oct. 13), but it is pain with a purpose for a brief moment in a woman's lifetime. It is not a sickness to be cured.
